snippet: While some Democrats who had hoped Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. would enter the race are now moving to Mrs. Clinton, others are hesitating.

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton's presidential campaign has moved quickly to try and enlist support of Democratic lawmakers and those with influence in party establishment who had supported Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr; some of people who had hoped Biden would enter race are still reluctant to switch sides, citing questions about her campaign and electability.
lead_paragraph: While some Democrats who had hoped Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. would enter the race are now moving to Mrs. Clinton, others are hesitating.

headline.print_headline: Clinton Campaign Moves to Enlist Biden Backers, Who Have Varying Desires to Join
headline.main: Hillary Clinton Advisers Woo Biden Backers, but Resistance Lingers
